subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}} [[File:Oke_neko.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|桶}} (''oke''): A small '''''oke''''' holding a cat.]] [[File:Fujimi_Fuji_view_field_in_the_Owari_province.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|桶}} (''oke''): A workman building a large '''''oke'''''.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|おけ|yomi=kun}} From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=おけ|-}}. Originally a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=おけ|麻|tr1=o|t1=flax, ramie|笥|tr2=ke|t2=a container, especially for foodstuffs or tableware}}.{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|おけ|hhira=をけ}}

# a tube-shaped container for holding split [[flax]] or [[hemp]], usually made of thin [[cypress]] wood bent to shape
# by extension, a [[pail]], [[bucket]], [[tub]], or [[basin]] similar to a [[barrel]] in construction, made of long thin pieces of [[cedar]] or cypress extending up from a base and held in place with [[hoop]]s; can be small enough to carry in one hand, or large enough to bathe in
# {{lb|ja|sort=おけ|Noh|_|theater}} a [[stool]] on [[stage]], on which an [[actor]] sits

subSections.title: Synonyms
subSections.text:
* {{sense|bucket}} {{ja-r|バケツ}}
* {{sense|stool}} {{ja-r|床%几|しょう%ぎ}}, {{ja-r|鬘桶|かつら おけ}}

subSections.title: Idioms
Derived terms
subSections.text:
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|桶%越し|おけ%ごし}}: using an ''oke'' to cross a river
* {{ja-r|桶%屋|おけ%や}}: a person or store that makes, fixes, and/or sells ''oke'' and well walls
* {{ja-r|桶%火|おけ%び}}: the fire in a ''hioke''
* {{ja-r|火%桶|ひ%おけ}}: a type of wooden [[hibachi]]
* {{ja-r|桶%狭%間|^おけ%はざ%ま}}: a place in the south of Midori-ku, Nagoya
* {{ja-r|桶%狭%間%焼き|^おけ%はざ%ま%-やき}}: a style of [[pottery]] originating near Okehazama
* {{ja-r|桶%結い|おけ%ゆい}}: tying cord bands around an ''oke''; an ''oke'' maker, an ''okeya''
* {{ja-r|桶%絞り|おけ%しぼり}}: a cloth [[dying]] process whereby the sections to leave undyed are put into ''oke'' and closed in with lids
* {{ja-r|桶%酸い|おけ%すい}}: alternate name for {{ja-r|酢の木|すのき|rom=-}}, {{ja-r|酢木|すのき}}: {{taxlink|Vaccinium smallii|species|noshow=1}}, var. ''glabrum'', a bush with edible (though sour) berries
* {{ja-r|桶%取り|おけ%とり}}: a scene in a ''[[狂言#Japanese|kyōgen]]'' farce presented between Noh plays; a woman working as a water carrier
* {{ja-r|桶%尻|おけ%じり}}: the [[aft]] edge of the [[hull]] of a ship in traditional Japanese [[shipbuilding]]
* {{ja-r|桶%据え|おけ%すえ}}: the [[hipbone]]
* {{ja-r|桶%川|^おけ%がわ}}: a river in southeast Saitama Prefecture
* {{ja-r|桶%側|おけ%がわ}}: the sides of an ''oke'', the [[stave]]s; a bowl-shaped container for holding trawling lines on a fishing boat
* {{ja-r|桶%側%胴|おけ%がわ% どう}}: a type of [[breastplate]] made of steel strips bound together, somewhat similar to how ''okegawa'' are bound together to make an ''oke''
* {{ja-r|桶%大%工|おけ%だい%く}}: a [[cooper]], a [[woodworker]] who specializes in making [[barrel]]s, ''oke'', and well walls
* {{ja-r|桶%胴|おけ% どう}}: alternate name for {{ja-r|桶%側%胴|おけ%がわ% どう}}; a type of {{m|en|taiko}} [[drum]]
* {{ja-r|桶%風%呂|おけ%ぶ%ろ}}: an ''oke'' fitted with a [[firebox]] for heating bathwater: a traditional Japanese wooden ''ofuro'' hottub
* {{ja-r|桶%伏せ|おけ%ぶせ}}: wearing an ''oke'' on one's head: a mob punishment in the pleasure districts of early Edo-period Japan, where non-paying customers would be forced to wear an ''oke'' on their heads, were sat down on the side of the street, and forced to pay up
{{der-bottom}}
